intro: Chelonistele brevilamellata, commonly known as the narrow-lamella chelonistele, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves with a distinctive, narrow lamina. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
